alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 03 at 10:39AM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Washington... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early tomorrow (Thursday) afternoon with a secondary rise Saturday to Moderate flood stage which is 19.5 feet. The river is expected to remain above flood stage through the coming weekend. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Kettle River Ferry above Curle 18.5 17.7 Wed 9 am PDT 18.5 18.6 19.4 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1100 AM PDT.
